com.datamirror.ts.derivedexpressionmanager

Interface DEUserExitIF

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DEUserExitSample

    public interface DEUserExitIF
    This interface contains a single method for handling user exit invocations from row selection and expressions. In Management Console, expressions can be defined to select or omit specific records in a table that are replicated, and transform replicated data to different formats. If the set of pre-defined column functions supported by InfoSphere CDC cannot be effectively combined to define the kind of manipulations you need, user exit classes that you have written can be called to perform the required operations. A specific function (%USER) provides the underlying support to call a user exit class with arguments from within an expression.

    To reference and invoke a user exit class from a %USER function defined in Management Console, the class must implement the DEUserExitIF interface. For instance, assume that you have imported the DEUserExitIF interface, and the user exit class that implements this interface in your Java program has the following definition:

    public class UE3 implements DEUserExitIF

    If UE3 contains code that accepts an eight-digit date format (01012001) and returns a date with the month fully expressed (January 1, 2001), you can specify an expression containing %USER('UE3', 01012001) when UE3 is a stand-alone class or you can specify an expression containing %USER('<Java package>.UE3', 01012001) when UE3 is included in a Java package.

    The DEUserExitIF interface for calling user exit classes from expressions defined in Management Console is located in the following package: com.datamirror.ts.derivedexpressionmanagermanager. For the user exit class that can be generated from the sample provided by InfoSphere CDC (DEUserExitSample.java), you can reference DEUserExitSample in a %USER function call. For more information about this sample exit class, see DEUserExitSample. For a stand-alone class or a class contained in a Java package that has been compressed into a JAR file, the class or JAR file must be located in your InfoSphere CDC installation directory or its full path must be referenced in the CLASSPATH environment variable. For a class in a Java package that has not been compressed into a JAR file, its full path must also be referenced in the CLASSPATH environment variable. However, the path must be appended with the name of the Java package in which the class is contained. These steps ensure that the class can be found and invoked when a %USER function call is performed.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.Object invoke(java.lang.Object[] objList)
      Handles all user exit class invocations from %USER column manipulation function calls embedded in Management Console expressions.

    • Method Detail

      • invoke

        java.lang.Object invoke(java.lang.Object[] objList)
                 throws UserExitInvalidArgumentException,
                        UserExitInvokeException
        Handles all user exit class invocations from %USER column manipulation function calls embedded in Management Console expressions. For information about the %USER function, see CDC Management Console Administration Guide.

        The set of arguments specified in the %USER call is passed to this method. These arguments are presented to the method as a list of Java objects. Arguments that are primitive data types are wrapped as Java objects. Therefore, you must convert the objects in order to work with the primitive arguments.

        This method should return a Java object that represents the result of the %USER function call which is referenced in the expression.

        Parameters:
        objList - The list of Java objects that represent the arguments specified in the %USER function call. Each argument is a Java object, and the order follows the sequence of arguments specified in the %USER call.
        Returns:
        The Java object that represents the result of the %USER function call which is referenced in the expression.
        Throws:
        UserExitInvalidArgumentException - if an invalid argument is encountered in the method
        UserExitInvokeException - if an error is encountered in the method
